ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Before age 30, (or currently, if subject is younger than 30 years old) did/do you have a lot of physical health problems or medical problems?
Was treatment sought, how often? How impairing? Record Response:
Have you missed work or school more than twice because of headaches?
Have you ever had any neurological problems such as: Temporary blindness in one or both eyes lasting several seconds or more?
Notes: 0= None; 1= Yes, mild (never saw physician, never took medication, did not interfere with usual activities); 2= Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use; 3= Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder; 4= Yes, medically unexplained.

ElementDescription: Have you ever had any neurological problems such as: Double Vision
Notes: 0= None; 1= Yes, mild (never saw physician, never took medication, did not interfere with usual activities); 2= Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use; 3= Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder; 4= Yes, medically unexplained.

ElementDescription: Have you ever had any neurological problems such as: Completely losing your hearing for a few seconds or longer
Notes: 0= None; 1= Yes, mild (never saw physician, never took medication, did not interfere with usual activities); 2= Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use; 3= Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder; 4= Yes, medically unexplained.

ElementDescription: Have you ever had any neurological problems such as: Being paralyzed, where you could not move a part of your body for at least a few minutes
Notes: 0= None; 1= Yes, mild (never saw physician, never took medication, did not interfere with usual activities); 2= Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use; 3= Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder; 4= Yes, medically unexplained.

ElementDescription: Have you ever had any neurological problems such as: Periods of weakness where you could not lift or move things you could normally lift or move
Notes: 0= None; 1= Yes, mild (never saw physician, never took medication, did not interfere with usual activities); 2= Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use; 3= Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder; 4= Yes, medically unexplained.

ElementDescription: Have you ever had any neurological problems such as: Trouble walking (balance or coordination problems)
Notes: 0= None; 1= Yes, mild (never saw physician, never took medication, did not interfere with usual activities); 2= Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use; 3= Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder; 4= Yes, medically unexplained.

ElementDescription: Have you ever had any neurological problems such as: Being unable to urinate or having difficulty urinating for 24 hours or longer or having to be catheterized (other than after childbirth or surgery)
Notes: 0= None; 1= Yes, mild (never saw physician, never took medication, did not interfere with usual activities); 2= Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use; 3= Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder; 4= Yes, medically unexplained.

ElementDescription: Have you ever had any neurological problems such as: Having a lump in your throat that made it difficult to swallow (other than when you feel like crying)
Notes: 0= None; 1= Yes, mild (never saw physician, never took medication, did not interfere with usual activities); 2= Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use; 3= Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder; 4= Yes, medically unexplained.

ElementDescription: Have you ever had any neurological problems such as: Having a seizure or convulsion (where you had staring spells or were unconscious and your body jerked)
Notes: 0= None; 1= Yes, mild (never saw physician, never took medication, did not interfere with usual activities); 2= Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use; 3= Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder; 4= Yes, medically unexplained.

ElementDescription: Have you ever had any neurological problems such as: Being unconscious or fainting (not seizures)
Notes: 0= None; 1= Yes, mild (never saw physician, never took medication, did not interfere with usual activities); 2= Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use; 3= Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder; 4= Yes, medically unexplained.

ElementDescription: Have you ever had any neurological problems such as: Amnesia for a period of several hours or days where you could not remember afterwards anything that happened?
Notes: 0= None; 1= Yes, mild (never saw physician, never took medication, did not interfere with usual activities); 2= Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use; 3= Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder; 4= Yes, medically unexplained.

ElementDescription: Have you ever had any neurological problems such as: Other similar symptoms, such as loss of speech, or numbness in a part of the body
Notes: 0= None; 1= Yes, mild (never saw physician, never took medication, did not interfere with usual activities); 2= Yes, always secondary to alcohol or drug use; 3= Yes, always part of medically explained physical disorder; 4= Yes, medically unexplained.

ElementDescription: Specify: Other similar symptoms, such as loss of speech, or numbness in a part of the body
